title: Zed: 46.7% Win Rate; 20% Ban Rate
body:
Kind of contradicts the idea that Zed is the pinnacle of healthy assassin designs. These bans obviously don't come from power level, people just don't want Zed to be in their games.
-----
EDIT: Sourced from LoLKing; evidently other websites have his banrate sitting at 45% in higher ELOs while his winrate climbs to a 47% even; this serves only to reinforce my point that him being banned right now has nothing to do with his power.

replies.body:
Zed bans come from people's immature perception of Zed and how he is basically better than everyone at everything in their eyes, whether it be poke or assassinating a target. People would much rather use a ban on him than increase their chances of winning by banning someone that either counters their team composition or is much more powerful than Zed at the time.

I honestly doubt many people would still play Zed now, even if he wasn't banned since he has been denied from the hands of his mains for so long. They are very likely rusty at him.

I just find Zed annoying to play against and don't trust my team not to feed him.  Considering how popular he is, you stand a good chance at banning out a one-trick Zed player too.

That said, Yasuo has the same qualities and I find he is more aggravating and popular.

I switched my mid ban of choice to Yas only because he's easier to not suck with. Zed at least has a decently high skill floor; Yasuo could be played by a drooling idiot and still do well.

Source: I tried playing Yas. Did well.
+1 for the self burn
I played Yas two times and failed miserably. I'm afraid to discover what I am if a drooling idiot can do well.

Drunk?

All joking aside, you might have just had the bad luck to get counterpicked. Or faced someone who hates Yasuo enough to practice facing him all the time.

wouldn't be an issue if zed didn't gain W + Q range for free damage. zed's Q is actually fast enough to be undodgeable, but rather zed is free to miss it, im not saying its easy to land every shuriken, but because of its speed anything less than max range its zeds projectile to miss. not dodge.

Jax is the only one without wave clear here and he smashes turrets and about 1-2 shots most minions. 

Even without the items, should that be an issue, Trynd and Fiora still have adequate wave clear. For Zed to properly wave clear, he needs to burn the shadow, leaving him heavily exposed while split pushing. Without the shadow, he will auto about as much as Trynd will at a slower rate.

And no, Zed does not take a tower quicker than anyone I mentioned. None at all. Because where they don't have armor pen (Although probably do), they have raw attack speed and damage. There's no scenario where A Zed could 100-0 a tower quicker than any of the champs I mentioned up there. He is not the best at split pushing, he is one of the worst of these champs I listed.


Zhonyas is the counter to Zed's ult, because it happens to counter it. But Zhonya's isn't an item designed to simply shut down spells efficiently. This is why Zhonyas doesn't have a 1 min CD to block most ults. It has a lengthy CD, and it's purpose is to counter something every two minutes, however it is not built to counter ultimates specifically or else it would be a 1 min CD. 


Late game, you use zhonyas so his ult doesn't kill you. Same concept as above, if you can't understand it and would rather try and satirically play with it, that's your problem. The item is there to counter something every 2 minutes; not counter ultimate spells. There is a difference. Zhonyas effectively counters Zed's ult, but it is not 100% or even close so effective at it because of CD differences. This goes for any spell in the game. Maw is there to counter magic damage, but due to the shield's CD, not simply -the answer- to magic damage. Building a maw doesn't mean magic damage won't kill you anymore, just like a Zhonyas doesn't mean you are immune to Zed. It just manipulates the outcomes of would-be situations typically in favor of you. Can't remember a time Maw fucked up my fight for me. 


And that last part was counter-cheeky because I agree with the guy you were responding to and against the guy he was responding to. Zhonyas having a higher CD I already discussed and that Zed is only really effective early-mid game. Afterwards he becomes a decent splitpusher, but his splitpush can be shut down easily by many common duelists we see in games today.

To your point about Zhonya's cd making it not intended to counter ultimates...

The cooldown used to be 90s before it was increased to 120 with the MYMU.  A 90s cooldown is pretty functional as a counter to ultimates, as they won't be used on you as soon as they're up, making the ~30s between ultimate and Zhonya's cd bearable.

With the increase to 120s however, that is a full minute+ between the ult and Zhonya's getting off their cds.

He gets a poke ranging from very little to colossal damage (Depends on your positioning) every 22 seconds. Riot gave the counterplay, if the players don't take it, it isn't their or Zed's fault. It's not free damage, it's completely CD and heavily so gated.
 You don't counter harass a 1400 max range Q. You don't get hit by a 1400 range Q. You're providing a ridiculous scenario in which you're just pumping up various strengths in a hyperbolic way. Yes, his Q is 1400 range. That is a 22 second CD, loss of mobility, and a long travel time along with possibly passing through a unit and dealing half damage. Also half the energy is gone. You harass when he CSs. He goes in (Remember, he's melee) and you Q. Simple. Or even auto.

You can Q more than 6 times in a lane. I don't know where your mana goes. Don't spam, land spells. Zed can "Spam" but each spam is relatively low in damage. Unless a full W-Q-Q-E combo hits you, you don't take much damage. Especially with the nerfed Q going through anything. Your jungler enver stops by, that's no fact. That's a personal experience in a game. My jungler stops by, we kill Zed. Their jungler stops by, they kill me (As Zed) when W is down. 

Zed can miss all the time, sure. He has no max resource to deplete in the sense mana does. However, his Q does less than yours unless possibly he hits you directly which isn't too easy in lane since if there's a clear path between Ahri and Zed, there's a clear path for charm. His Q does heavily reduced damage, yours is an amazing wave clear.


Zed is imbalanced early game, this is true. Why? Late game he is weak. He gained late game power due to QSS removal and nerfing of Zhonya so it isnt staple on anything with an AP scaling, however he lost 4 seconds on rank 1 W and lost AD ratio and base damage on Q. So they balanced his power out a bit, and that's why in lane he's weaker than before and late game he can still try and be relevant. Champions are designed this way. They typically have power spikes early, mid or late game. It's just the early game powerhouses are hated due to the efficiency of damage early levels. No Mundo has fun getting popped by Zed's ult early game, but no Mundo puts down his bag of popcorn as Zed's ult tickles late game. 



Your comparing two champions unfairly to each other with a victim complex. "Ahri cant do this this or this, Zed can do this this and this.

Here's bare bones what both kits offer and maybe this will help you see balance, or at least allow others scanning your comments not to be simply fooled and run around banning Zed.


Zed: Mostly AD damage, passive is magic but not enough to warrant factoring in resistance wise. Long CD mobility spell that doubles as harass. Energy based, high damage. Ult requires large set up time. Hardly any CC (Only slow is on that 22 second CD). Some people consider Zed's ult a mobility spell. It's situationaly mobile. Need to hop a wall? It doesn't simply do that. Need to get to lane faster? Doesn't do that. Side step a skill shot? Doesn't do that. Catch up to someone, it can kind of do that should you be in range. Can sidestep a skillshot by ulting someone, but that's a full commitment which might not be an option. Melee based, has a ranged poke that severely cuts damage should it hit anything first. Can get in and out pretty easily with use of shadows. Good AOE.

Ahri: Full AP assassin/mage, no AD aside from autos. Has sustain, hard CC and true damage. Extreme mobility in the form of a triple dash ult requiring no lock on and a speed boost upon using Q. However, as mobility is on an ult, less opportunities to be mobile, but better when doing so. Mobility also deals great damage. Ranged, mana dependent. Heavily skill shot oriented, but like champs like Panth, has a guaranteed combo should CC land. Great AOE, can get in and out with ult easily. 



They're both great champs, but they do different things and hold different strengths and weaknesses.

Here's the biggest problem you seem to have. Zed's Q. You see it as a resourceless, easily hit skillshot that chunks and does so much for Zed. I see why you see that. Now compare Ahri and Zed's Qs. 

Zed: Linear pass-through skill shot costing about 25-33% energy. Physical damage. Can have extended range every so often.
Ahri: Linear pass-through skill shot costing up to 85 mana, no percentages involved due to a logically infinite mana pool. Not saying it's better than energy, I just can't assign a direct percentage since mana isn't fixed. Deals magic and TRUE damage, provides a speed boost and provides sustain.


Now see this? Zed's Q is only damage. Itemizable-against damage. It has 0 other purpose. Ahri's Q provides utility, sustain and damage that can't be fully itemized against. This is why Zed gets more Q's than ahri. It's why it's faster and more direct. It's simply damage, and often even less than Ahri's. While Zed loses damage for multiple targets hit, Ahri charges passive and possibly heals MORE for more targets hit, all while everyone takes equal damage and Ahri gets a speed boost. So yes, Ahri has to manage mana, and maybe aim a little more carefully and decide when the best time to Q is while Zed can theoretically just press Q when off CD and not care (Ignoring lane shoving and how devastating that can be.) So while Zed gets this "Free ride" Q, it only does some damage. Ahri has to be careful with hers, but it heals, hurts and speeds up. It's also a more active zone, but that's a subjective thought from me. Zed's Q does some damage but if behind creeps, it will do a sliver. If Ahri's hits you, you get chunked hard due to true damage. This makes her Q more dangerous and makes it so she zones much better. 

Ahri's Q is a standalone ability. It does what it does and that's it with very little synergy with the rest of the kit aside from the little speed boost. Zed's Q is a synergy ability that increases the damage his R does and makes his W have more utility with the possibility of many Qs. 

But your problem seems to be early game and Q spam, that which isn't factored as much with the synergy. So until ult comes, Ahri and Zed have stand alone Qs, both functioning differently and paying prices relative to the power they're given from it.

>Deals magic and TRUE damage, provides a speed boost and provides sustain.

I just want to note that its her passive that provides sustain, which is by no means great early game, that she has to spend 3 spells minimum to activate and another to proc. It just sounded like you were intentionally making it sound like her Q is overloaded.
